meanings.definition: Treat (a sacred place or thing) with violent disrespect.
meanings.sent1: The vandals desecrated the church by spray painting graffiti on its walls.
meanings.sent2: It is wrong to desecrate a cemetery by damaging the gravestones.
meanings.sent3: The children thought it would be funny to desecrate the school's flag by drawing on it.
meanings.sent4: His actions seemed to desecrate the very essence of the peaceful garden.
meanings.sent5: The act of desecrating a temple is a serious offense in many cultures.

meanings.definition: Violate the sacred character of a place or language.
meanings.sent1: The developers desecrated the forest by cutting down all the trees.
meanings.sent2: It is important not to desecrate the traditions of a community.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that bad grammar can desecrate the beauty of a language.
meanings.sent4: The construction of the new building seemed to desecrate the historic charm of the town.
meanings.sent5: The company's decision to desecrate the natural landscape was met with strong opposition.
